intro: Trichelostylis rudgeana, commonly known as the broad-leafed trichelostylis, is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its broad, elliptical leaves that are often prominently veined. The plant produces fragrant, yellowish-green inflorescences that are typical of the genus. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
